sections.title: Mission
sections.snippet: Does everyone know what they’re fighting for? What is your mission?

sections.title: Values
sections.description: Core values the company lives by
sections.snippet:
Core values are the fundamental beliefs of the company. List the company's values. Explain where
          they came from, why they're important, and provide examples of how people can use them to guide their
          decisions, behavior, and actions.

sections.title: Diversity
sections.snippet:
Discuss company policy and goals around gender, race and ethnicity, age, and sexuality.
          What is the current state of diversity at the company? What are the goals? What changes in hiring,
          culture and retention are you working on to achieve those goals?

sections.title: Competition
sections.snippet:
Who are the competitors you’re paying attention to? How do they compare? Besides your competitors,
          what are the other major external threats to your business?

sections.title: Founder's Update
sections.snippet: Provide an overview of important happenings in the company since the last update.

sections.title: Highlights
sections.snippet: What new company milestones or accomplishments are you most proud of? List up to three.

sections.title: Growth
sections.description: Growth metrics and key performance indicators
sections.snippet: Provide context about recent growth. Why are these metrics important? How are they performing against targets? What is impacting them?
sections.prompt:
Enter the most important growth metric for the stakeholders of your company. You'll be able
          to add more later.

sections.title: Key Challenges
sections.snippet:
What are you most disappointed about? What’s your plan to fix it going forward?
          What is the company stuck on? What are the systemic or existential threats everyone needs to be focused on?

sections.title: Key Takeaways
sections.snippet:
What’s something you recently learned about your business, market, customers, or product?
          What changes are you making as a result?

sections.title: Team and Hiring
sections.snippet:
Announce and welcome new hires. Discuss what positions are currently open and what's being
          done to fill them. How many candidates are applying for the positions? Which employees are no longer
          with the company and why did they leave?

sections.title: Product
sections.snippet:
What tests have you run to validate your product? What did you learn? What's
          shipped recently and how has the roadmap changed? How is the product performing? What's not working? What's
          the evidence you are making something some people love?

sections.title: Customer Service
sections.snippet:
What issues are customers having with your product? How are your service metrics and
          SLA's performing? How are customer service costs and support metrics trending? What new content
          and policies have been created to improve customer success?

sections.title: Marketing and Customer Acquisition
sections.snippet:
List any notable marketing activities since the last update. How are the current marketing
          efforts performing? What changes and new activities are planned?

sections.title: Press
sections.snippet: List any notable press mentions since the last update. Provide an update on PR activities.

sections.title: Sales
sections.description: Notable sales activity and wins and losses
sections.snippet: Did you close any notable sales? What opportunities are in the pipeline?

sections.title: Business Development
sections.description: Notable partnership activity and new deals
sections.snippet: Did you close any notable deals / partnerships? What opportunities are in the pipeline?

sections.title: How You Can Help
sections.description: Ask your company stakeholders for help and ideas
sections.snippet: Where do you need the most help from your team and investors? Be specific.

sections.title: Kudos
sections.description: Celebrate great actions that helped the company
sections.snippet: Who went above and beyond to help the company? What did they do?

sections.title: Finances
sections.description: Cash on hand, burn and runway
sections.snippet: Provide context about recent changes in company finances

sections.title: Compensation
sections.description: Founder, executive and employee compensation practices
sections.snippet:
You can discuss the
          thought process used to determine salaries/equity/commissions/bonuses/profit share. You may
          want to share the founder/CEO/executive to average employee compensation ratio. You might
          discuss compensation by various roles (engineering, marketing, sales...). If it's part of
          your company culture, you could link to a spreadsheet of all employee salaries. Provide
          information only in accordance with your company culture.

sections.title: Ownership
sections.snippet:
How many shares are outstanding? What's the size of the employee option pool? Is there
          a formula to allocate employee options? What's the value placed on the companyduring the last raise?
          Has a 409A valuation been done, what was the value? Provide an easy to understand
          summary of the cap table. What % of the company is owned by founders/employees/investors? What terms
          and preferences do investors have and what do they mean?

sections.title: Fundraising
sections.snippet:
When are you raising? How much are you raising? What is the purpose of the funds? Link to the
          pitch deck. What’s plan B if you can’t raise as you expect to? Who did you meet with and how did the
          meetings go? After the raise, discuss who the investors are and the terms of the deal.
